inventory.commentary: 7Jan08 added 2 senses, features, update to wn 2.1 ahouston

sense.name: officer who presides at a meeting of an organization
sense.commentary: CHAIRMAN[+entity][+person][+officer][+of_meetng] [+relation][+role][+supervisor][+of_meeting] president, chairwoman, chairman, chairperson, chair - the officer who presides at the meetings of an organization Note: can imply a temporary, stand-in role (one meeting) or a general role
sense.examples: Address your remarks to the chairman of the meeting. Bob will be chairman this evening as Mary could not attend the meeting.

sense.name: the administrative head of an academic department
sense.commentary: CHAIRMAN[+entity][+person][+administrator][+head][+of_department][+academic] [+relation][+role][+administrator][+of_department] Note: implies a long-standing role in a department,
sense.examples: Who is now chairman of the philosophy department? After John received tenure, he became chairman of the economics department for two years.

sense.name: the bearer or carrier of a sedan
sense.commentary: A person who carries a chair, transports a person in a chair, sedan Note: somewhat archaic usage
sense.examples: The gentleman hailed a chairman to carry him back to his hotel.
